title: Bug 37021 - Source path incorrect in declare warning on binary files
description: Bug 37021 - The source path is incorrect in declare warning on binary files [java|aj]. To see the problem, please run the code located at tests/new/binaryWarnings/.. Please note that the tests have limitations - they may give false positives due to the lack of filename checking in harness verification of messages (which is not enabled). I observed this issue in AJDT, where AJDT simply omits the filename if it doesn't make sense to them.
OB: In declare warning messages when targeting .class files from injars, the source path is listed as 'app.Main.class' instead of 'app/Main'. There are also cases where the filenames don't appear at all, but these tests didn't reproduce that problem.
EB: In declare warning messages when targeting .class files from injars, the source path should be listed as 'app/Main' instead of 'app.Main.class'.
SR:
1. Open the project
2. Compile the project
3. View the declare warning messages for the .class files in the injars
4. Observe that the source path is listed incorrectly as 'app.Main.class' instead of 'app/Main'
